headline: WOMEN VOTERS WON FOR BIRTH CONTROL; State Convention Approves Enlarging Doctors' Rights in Giving Wives Information. SPIRITED FIGHT ON FLOOR First Vote Shows Proposal Lost, but a Recount Brings Victory for It, 53 to 42.
snippet: SYRACUSE, Dec. 2. -- After a spirited fight over birth control on the convention floor today the New York League of Women Voters, by a vote of 53 to 42, endorsed the proposed amendment to the Penal Code permitting physicians to give contraceptive...

headline: FEARS BIRTH CONTROL THREATENS THE WEST; F.A. MacKenzie Warns That Our Civilization Faces Bankruptcy and Eastern Domination.
snippet: LONDON, Oct. 29. -- Although admitting that England is overpopulated, F.A. MacKenzie, writing in The Spectator, declares that if the policy of large restriction of families becomes general in Western countries, Western civilization may become...

headline: SEES MORAL CRISIS ENDANGERING RACE; Heidelberg Professor Blames Industrialism, Radicalism and Birth Control. NADIR FOLLOWED THE WAR He Puts Hope of Return of Virtue in Physical and Moral Development Without Preaching.
snippet: BERLIN, Oct. 26. -- The high ideals of chastity which swayed the middle classes and flourished at its zenith from 1820 to 1880 have been shattered and ravaged until, less than five decades later, the standards of virtue have reached a crisis...

headline: A CHANGED LUTHERAN VIEW.; Suggested Possibilities Under Altered Birth Control Stand.
snippet: In THE TIMES of Oct. 2 I read that the Lutherans in their "move to curb divorce" are "against birth control." This comes as sort of a surprise to many Lutherans, Because, as THE TIMES says, "The proposed declaration on birth control seemed to many...

headline: CUMMINS AND BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: To the general public the name of Senator Cummins probably means railroad legislation. To a lesser public his career stands as an instance of a vital progressive evolved into a static conservative. By another part of the public he will be...

headline: BIRTH CONTROL; BIRTH CONTROL AND THE STATE. A Plea and a Forecast. By C.P. Blacker. 87 pp. Today and Tomorrow Series. New York: E.P. Dutton & Co. $1.
snippet: IN this latest little volume of the frequently stimulating but not always important Today and Tomorrow Series a question that is coming vigorously and insistently to a position where it will have to be met and answered receives dignified and judicial...

headline: FOR BIRTH CONTROL PENSION; Margaret Sanger Urges Payments to Unfit Who Forego Parenthood.
snippet: M Sanger urges payment to unfit who forego parenthood

headline: TWO BOLT WOMEN'S CLUB.; Reset Jersey Federation's Approval of Birth Control Bill.
snippet: Mrs Arnold Kellenberger and Mrs Wm Halfpenny resign, opposing birth control bills and other measures

headline: BARS PROPAGANDA ON BIRTH CONTROL; Italy Appoints a Special Committee to Combat It and 'Protect' the Family.
snippet: Italy appts com to combat propaganda, and "protect" family

headline: PLAN WORLD BUREAU FOR BIRTH CONTROL; International Delegates Will Organize It at Geneva in August, Says Dr. Little. SAYS MOVEMENT ADVANCES Civilization Not Yet Ready for General Propaganda, Asserts University President.
snippet: A conference to discuss birth control will take place next August in Geneva just prior to the Seventh Assembly of the League of Nations. Dr. C.C. Little, President of the University of Michigan, and since last year President of the International...

headline: BLAMES BIRTH CONTROL IN BABY BUGGY DECLINE; Manufacturer Says Autos Also Have Helped to Wreck His Industry.
snippet: F Adams, mfr, says automobiles and birth control have wrecked the business

headline: Commons Rejects Birth Control Bill.
snippet: House of Commons rejects bill providing instruction in birth control to women of poorer classes

headline: EPISCOPALIANS JOIN BIRTH CONTROL FOES; National Council Agrees to Aid Catholics' War on Law Which Would Lift Ban on Data.
snippet: The National Council of the Episcopal Church voted yesterday at a meeting in the Church Missions House, 281 Fourth Avenue, to join forces with the Roman Catholic Church in combating Federal legislation concerning birth control. The council took this...
